result.markdown:
---
title: Overview
---

  
Set-up information:

* Instructors
* Outline - learning objectives (can also do on a per-episode basis)
* Prerequisites
* Shared documents (etherpad or google doc) links - for introducing themselves and asking questions
* Course etiquette
* Timetable


Introduction: 

* Background information about bottom-up MS    
  + why we do expression proteomics (study changes in protein abundance)?
  + what is bottom-up proteomics and why?
  + label-free vs. label-based methods for quantitation
  + brief overview of mass spec (i.e., MS1 vs. MS2, define PSM etc)
  + processing of raw mass spec data using third party software
  + output table of an identification search (include link to excel)
* Explanation of the use-case data

Provide reference to F1000 paper for additional information

## Instructors

This workshop will be run by: 

* Lisa M. Breckels - Cambridge Centre for Proteomcis, University of Cambridge
* Charlotte Hutchings - Cambridge Centre for Proteomcis, University of Cambridge
* Charlotte S. Dawson - Cambridge Centre for Proteomcis, University of Cambridge
* Thomas Krueger - Department of Biochemistry, University of Cambridge


## Course prerequisites 

This workshop is aimed at learners who are interested in developing their skills
using R for the analysis of expression proteomics data. **A working knowledge of R is assumed and essential. If you are not familiar with R and the RStudio environment, you will struggle on this course.** If you are not confident using R, we strongly suggest that you
work through an introductory R course before attending this course. 
**A basic understanding of proteomics is also expected.**
